title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 January 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:41 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
00:52 <tillo> has quit  
01:18 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
03:06 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
04:08 <tekzilla> has quit  
04:10 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:47 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:54 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
04:55 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
05:15 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
05:43 <Guest23744> has quit  
06:00 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis2> has quit  
08:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <vmassol> sburjan`: good morning  
09:03 <mflorea> Good morning guys. We have a strange issue on xwiki-enterprise-text-extension. XWikiServletContextListener fails to find the default ObservationManager and CM fails because with "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class java.util.Formatter"  
09:03 <mflorea> I can reproduce locally  
09:03 <vmassol> interesting  
09:05 <mflorea> XWikiSerlvetContextListener calls CM for ObservationManager, CM fails and tries to log the exception but String.format fails because of java.util.Formatter  
09:08 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <sburjan`> hello vmassol  
09:13 <vmassol> sburjan`: nothing actually, I was wondering if the skin at space level was busted or not but it's probably just that the guy used a non existing skin  
09:13 <tmortagne> Denis: Hi  
09:13 <tmortagne> any idea what would cause what's described on "Failed migration from 3.0 to 4.3.1" on mailing list  
09:13 <tmortagne> looks like there is also another mail with the same issue  
09:13 <sburjan`> vmassol: I'm sure the guy didn't knew we removed toucan. I've updated the documentation  
09:14 <tmortagne> "Upgrading from XWiki Enterprise 2.3 to 4.4"  
09:14 <vmassol> guys, am I right in saying that on a farm, the only way to install pages that require PR is with a global user that has PR? And even when installing a backup pack (if the user is XWiki.Admin - ie local admin) the pages will not get PR  
09:15 <tmortagne> vmassol: well it depends user is supposed to be xwiki:XWiki.Admin in most of ours xar now  
09:16 <tmortagne> so ackup pack should work too  
09:16 <tmortagne> as long as it's done with a user who have PR  
09:16 <vmassol> tmortagne: that's provided such a user exists  
09:16 <tmortagne> sure  
09:16 <vmassol> for example on myxwiki.org do we have it? checking  
09:16 <tmortagne> that's that does not have anything to do with subwikis  
09:16 <tmortagne> I think we have it  
09:17 <tmortagne> by anyway yes we have an issue with PR for any subwiki admin that want to upgrade his wiki  
09:17 <vmassol> yes there's one: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Admin  
09:18 <tmortagne> if you don't have PR you are not supposed to have the right to import as backup pack  
09:18 <tmortagne> it used to be that way, hope it's still the case  
09:18 <vmassol> hmm really, didn't know that  
09:18 <vmassol> what happens?  
09:18 <vmassol> an error?  
09:18 <vmassol> you're not shown the option?  
09:18 <tmortagne> don't remember, I think you are not supposed to see the option yes  
09:19 <vmassol> so for myxwiki.org users cannot actually upgrade their wikis?  
09:20 <tmortagne> not all the pages yes but most of the pages that require PR to work at all are for wrong reason  
09:21 <tmortagne> requiring PR to display an index of pages is a bug  
09:21 <vmassol> well it's pretty sreious since the home page will bug  
09:21 <vmassol> since the Activity page requires PR  
09:21 <tmortagne> the home page require PR ?  
09:21 <AndreasJonsson> From Package.Import: boolean backup = this.backupPack && isFarmAdmin(context);  
09:22 <vmassol> yep through Main.Activity  
09:22 <tmortagne> seriously...  
09:22 <tmortagne> we are not supposed to have any page requiring PR in XE and we make it worst  
09:22 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: ok, so it'll seem to work but won't in practice?  
09:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: we've always had for a long time, this is not new  
09:22 <vmassol> we even have a marker for these pages  
09:23 <vmassol> so it's not like we didn't know… :)  
09:23 <tmortagne> vmassol: it does not make it good  
09:23 <tmortagne> the home page was not requiring PR before  
09:23 <vmassol> sure but it makes myxwiki.org unusable to upgrade  
09:23 <vmassol> the home page doesn't require PR  
09:23 <tmortagne> so we keeping adding new PR pages  
09:23 <vmassol> but Main.Activity does  
09:23 <vmassol> thus breaking the home page  
09:23 <tmortagne> it's the same  
09:24 <AndreasJonsson> vmassol: no isFarmAdmin means admin rights on main wiki.  For admins of subwikis, the backup flag is cleared.  
09:24 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: you mean they cannot sleect the option?  
09:25 <vmassol> or the option is discarded if selected?  
09:25 <AndreasJonsson> I don't know if they can select the option, but it will be cleared if they can.  
09:25 <vmassol> ok  
09:25 <vmassol> thanks  
09:28 <vmassol> ok guys I've just replied to the thread "No Activity Stream"  
09:28 <vmassol> if you could verify that what I've said is correct that would be great  
09:28 <vmassol> this seems really worse than I thought initially  
09:30 <sburjan`> tmortagne: the failing migration is on MS SQL, it might be the cause ?  
09:30 <sburjan`> since we're not supporting it  
09:30 <tmortagne> sburjan`: he gets a message saying that migration are disabled  
09:30 <tmortagne> if true then the message is at least very bad  
09:31 <tmortagne> and anyway I don't think we have any test for some officially supportedl database at this leve  
09:31 <sburjan`> nope, not yet  
09:32 <tmortagne> so there is a bug for sure or something very weird in the configuration if you get a message telling you you did not enabled migration when you enabled it  
09:41 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <vmassol> one good news about all the xwiki.org restarts is that the bot works quite well and restarts well by itself :)  
10:05 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <vmassol> normally playground messages are gone and I've temporarily removed broken links (I need to work more on it, it seems to stop working after the first hits)  
10:06 <vmassol> hmm no luck :)  
10:10 <vmassol> it seems it's honoring only the first exclude  
10:10 <vmassol> debugging  
10:12 <vmassol> guys, are we ready to release 4.5M1 today?  
10:12 <vmassol> I feel that we should release it, even with the existing blockers: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=resolution+%3D+Unresolved+and+priority+%3D+Blocker+and+category+%3D+%22Top+Level+Projects%22+and+issue+not+in+%28%22XCOMMONS-324%22%29  
10:13 <vmassol> wdyt?  
10:13 <vmassol> we also need to fix the max blockers for Monday when we're supposed to release 4.4.1 (sending email about that one, I had forgotten)  
10:18 <vmassol> mail sent  
10:19 <vmassol> ahah could be very nice for us: http://www.clahub.com/  
10:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: just rebuilt XE, started it and went to the EM UI  
11:34 <vmassol> it fails  
11:35 <vmassol> http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=mWUKSL1p  
11:35 <vmassol> maybe it's what mflorea just reported  
11:36 <vmassol> or xwiki.org is down....  
11:36 <vmassol> yeah seems that's the case...  
11:36 <tmortagne> Caused by: java.io.IOException: Invalid answer (503) fo the server when requesting  
11:37 <tmortagne> yes xwiki.org issue it seems  
11:37 <mflorea> vmassol: yes, it's not the same issue, the server started in your case  
11:37 <tmortagne> also what mflorea reported is an issue in the repository module which is not part of XE  
11:37 <vmassol> ok  
11:38 <mflorea> yes, that's why only extensions tests are having the problem  
11:38 <vmassol> ok better now  
11:43 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
11:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <vmassol> the drupal profiles are interesting for example: http://drupal.org/user/24967  
12:00 <vmassol> (committers: http://drupal.org/node/3060/committers )  
12:05 <sburjan> last commit 11 years ago ? is drupal that old ? :)  
12:43 <mflorea> has quit  
12:49 <vmassol> guys, wdyt about removing the 4.3 branch building on CI ftm? (it's easy to add back with the script if we ever need it back)  
12:53 <xwikibeginner> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <xwikibeginner> has quit  
12:57 <wikinewbie> has joined #xwiki  
12:57 <ldubost> has quit  
12:58 <wikinewbie> Hello folks.  
12:59 <vmassol> hi wikinewbie  
13:02 <wikinewbie> Sorry to bother folks, but can I ask some really stupid questions?  Am working on an event listener and really a bit stuck.  
13:02 <vmassol> sure, I'm having lunch right now so I may be slow ;)  
13:30 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:31 <cjd> is now known as <Guest75770>  
13:38 <vmassol> ok found the problem with the ircbot exclude  
13:57 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: the "install on farm" button is only visible when you're on the main wiki right? And compared to "install on wiki" the difference is only that components are registered against the root cm right?  
13:59 <tmortagne> vmassol: for jar yes, for xar it means it's installed everywhere and when a wiki is created it's automatically installed there too etc  
14:00 <vmassol> ah hmm had forgotten that part  
14:00 <vmassol> so there's no way to have the ui installed only on a wiki and have the components in the root cm?  
14:00 <tmortagne> not if you install them all in the same install job  
14:00 <tmortagne> but you can install them separately  
14:01 <vmassol> ok that's an issue for my use case then
